A4.text: The firebombing of Tokyo, codenamed Operation Meetinghouse, on 9â€“10 March, killed an estimated 100,000 people and destroyed 41 km2 (16 sq mi) of the city and 267,000 buildings in a single night.

A5.text: On 6 and 9 August 1945, the United States detonated two atomic bombs over the Japanese cities of Hiroshima and Nagasaki, respectively, during World War II.
